post1.title: Covid-19 in Ireland
post1.content: Last updated on 2020-03-28 10:46 PM IST . . Total Confirmed: 2,415 . Total Deaths: 36 . Total Recovered: 5 . . . Important: Starting on March 16th, 2020, Ireland has more #COVID19 cases per million (and growing quickly) than the most affected countries in Europe, Italy and Spain, at their early stages. . . cases_ie.tail() . date country cases new_cases days_since_10_cases . 18 2020-03-24 | Ireland | 1329 | 204 | 18 | . 19 2020-03-25 | Ireland | 1564 | 235 | 19 | . 20 2020-03-26 | Ireland | 1819 | 255 | 20 | . 21 2020-03-27 | Ireland | 2121 | 302 | 21 | . 22 2020-03-28 | Ireland | 2415 | 294 | 22 | . . Number of Covid-19 cases per million . The respective population of Ireland, Italy, and Spain is as follows (in millions) [source]: . Ireland : 4.9M | Italy : 60.2M | Spain : 47.1M | . If we plot a figure dividing the total number of cases reported daily by the population (in millions) we can find how many persons are infected per 1 million, which give us a normalized value we could use to understand the severity of the outbreak. . The figure below shows that in fact Ireland has more cases per million than the most affected countries in Europe starting on March 16th, 2020, and growing quickly. . . Data Sources . Government of Ireland [https://www.gov.ie/] | 2019 Novel Coronavirus COVID-19 (2019-nCoV) Data Repository by Johns Hopkins CSSE [https://github.com/CSSEGISandData/COVID-19] | .

post3.title: Covid-19 in Ireland
post3.content: Last updated on 2020-03-26 10: 02 PM IST . . Total Confirmed: 1819 . Total Deaths: 19 . Total Recovered: 5 . . . Important: Starting on March 16th, 2020, Ireland has more #COVID19 cases per million (and growing quickly) than the most affected countries in Europe, Italy and Spain, at their early stages. . . Number of Covid-19 cases per million . The respective population of Ireland, Italy, and Spain is as follows (in millions) [source]: . Ireland : 4.9M | Italy : 60.2M | Spain : 47.1M | . If we plot a figure dividing the total number of cases reported daily by the population (in millions) we can find how many persons are infected per 1 million, which give us a normalized value we could use to understand the severity of the outbreak. . The figure below shows that in fact Ireland has more cases per million than the most affected countries in Europe starting on March 16th, 2020, and growing quickly. . . Data Sources . Government of Ireland [https://www.gov.ie/] | 2019 Novel Coronavirus COVID-19 (2019-nCoV) Data Repository by Johns Hopkins CSSE [https://github.com/CSSEGISandData/COVID-19] | .
